WRITING.TITLE: The dirty secret media coverage has ignored: The U.S. has its own large ivory trade that's not adequately regulated.

Shrinking household size may offset progress in curbing global population, new study finds. We want to live with fewer people in larger houses, which means we're consuming as much as a larger population would.
Greenland's Jakobshavn Glacier, source of 1912 Titanic iceberg, is flowing at world record speed of 46 meters per day, researchers calculate.
Greenland's Jakobshavn Glacier, source of 1912 Titanic iceberg, is flowing at world record speed of 46 meters per day, researchers calculate.
Powered by solar panels and biomass, microgrids are spreading slowly across India, where 300 million people live without electricity.
Researchers generate electricity by changing humidity around spores. Moistening and then drying a pound of them produces enough force to lift a car one meter.
TIL that cities and traffic planners can use snowfall to test how "neckdowns" (curb extenders) affect traffic and pedestrians.
NASA satellite data show severity of California's record-setting drought -- worst in the state's 163-year history.
European and Japanese demand for non-GM soy may be boosting green agriculture in the Amazon.
European and Japanese demand for non-GM soy may be boosting green agriculture in the Amazon
Major study by EPA finds Pebble Mine would destroy Alaska's Bristol Bay area. It's a potentially fatal blow for the mine's future.
Smart grids could be big winners in Google's purchase of smart thermostat maker Nest.
Smart grids could be big winners in Google's purchase of smart thermostat maker Nest.
Genetically engineering species to bring back extinct ones: fascinating, far-fetched, irresponsible...or all of the above?
Antarctica's emperor penguins have altered their breeding behavior in the face of sea ice loss. They now climb 100-ft sheer ice walls to lay and incubate their eggs.
Solar Geoengineering: A cheap tool that could green the world, or a slippery slope toward irreversibly screwing up our atmosphere? Scientists and environmentalists debate.
